techmeme.title: Google donates $1M to Trump's inauguration, saying the donation, a YouTube livestream, and a homepage link to the event are in line with previous inaugurations (Ashley Capoot/CNBC)
Analysis: Elon Musk's UK obsession is driven by a few X accounts; an ex-Twitter exec says Musk may be the first tech leader to be radicalized by his own product (Financial Times)
Amazon launches Amazon Retail Ad Service to let companies show ads in search results, product pages, and other areas of their own websites, initially in the US (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
Dublin-based Xocean, which provides ocean data to the energy and hydrography industries using uncrewed surface vessels, raised €115M, taking its total to ~$189M (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
Apple says it "has never used Siri data to build marketing profiles" and never sold it for advertising or other purposes, after paying $95M to settle a lawsuit (Richard Lawler/The Verge)
